p: The cultivation of fruiting body and mycelium, the production of bioactive components in short time and the possibility of manipulation to optimize production are some of the most renowned mushrooms’ advantages as a source of functional foods and beneficial natural molecules ( Ferreira et al., 2009). From the perspective of nutrient source, mushrooms contain high protein and low-fat contents, along with a high amount of vitamins B, C, D, and K, minerals, including potassium and phosphorus, and also selenium as a trace element. They have also considerable amounts of dietary fibers ( Badalyan, 2014), chitin and β-glucans as functional components ( Manzi et al., 2001).
